title.narrative: Self-reliance and Sustainability of peace in conflict affected areas of Aguok South, North and Aguok

description.narrative:
South Sudan has been at war since the fiftieth of last century, this prolonged war denied the South Sudanese communities and families a chance to live together as clan or communities and enjoy peace, and hence the high rampant cases of violence still exist. 90% of the current South Sudanese were born in war and have never experienced peace and love, their minds are stocked with war memories and many of them are traumatized. The Gogrial west county community in Warrap has never experienced peace which makes them suffer from peace deficiency and they are not able to demonstrate peace to their neighboring communities, this has contributed to an increase of community clashes especially in the areas inhabited by Apuk and Aguok tribes.
The project is aimed to conduct activities to reduce inter-clan violence by creating awareness on the importance of women empowerment and peaceful coexistence among the communities, and creating a friendly village forum where people discuss issues related to violence which causes insecurity in the area. By the end of the project the village forum will be empowered to establish the village help desk where by violence cases will be reported and handled. The project activities will also provide the traumatized community with healing process through village public debates and drama where the community will freely discuss their differences and solutions and establish a peaceful society where people live in harmony and perfect peace.
The partner will focus to rebuild the scattered communities through peace and reconciliation processes. There are already established strong rapport with government officials and other stake-holders who are around the region of Bhar el Ghazal. The project team will have regular meetings and communication with government functionaries and the targeted beneficiaries.
